Docs.summary: Contains values used to join and drop multicast groups.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use a <xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption> to store the <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> of a multicast group you want to join or drop. Use the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SetSocketOption%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method with the following parameters to join a multicast group.
|Parameter|Value| |---------------|-----------| |socketOptionLevel|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionLevel?displayProperty=fullName>| |socketOptionName|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName.AddMembership>| |object|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption>|
Use <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName.DropMembership> to drop a multicast group.
## Examples The following examples join the default IP interface to an IP multicast group. They assume the IP multicast group address in the range 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.
